description: From Middle English *halibutt, equivalent to holy +‎ but (“flatfish”), since the fish was often eaten on holy days. Compare Dutch heilbot, German Heiligbutt, Heilbutt, Heilbutte. Compare also Danish helleflynder, Swedish helgeflundra.

entries.meaning: A large flatfish of the genus Hippoglossus, which sometimes leaves the ocean floor and swims vertically.
